projectPurpose: To provide a high-performance, GPU compute-centric 2D graphics rendering engine for efficiently handling large and complex 2D scenes.
mainFeatures: Draw large 2D scenes with interactive or near-interactive performance
PostScript-inspired drawing API (shapes, images, gradients, text)
Leverages GPU compute shaders for parallelizing work

alternatives.name: Skia
mainFeatures: Used by major products (Chrome, Android, Flutter)

alternatives.name: Cairo
mainFeatures: 2D graphics library with multiple output devices

alternatives.name: Direct2D
mainFeatures: High-quality rendering for geometry, bitmaps, text

alternatives.name: ThorVG
mainFeatures: Renders vector scenes and animations (SVG, Lottie)
Used in Tizen OS, Godot, LVGL
Designed for embedded and general use

alternatives.name: Pathfinder
mainFeatures: Designed for fonts and vector graphics
Can use GPU compute for path conversion
Supports multiple backends (OpenGL, Vulkan, Metal, D3D)

marketPositioning: Vello is positioned as a cutting-edge, experimental 2D graphics rendering engine that differentiates itself through a strong emphasis on GPU compute for maximizing performance on modern hardware, particularly for complex scenes. It aims to be a high-performance alternative to more traditional renderers like Skia and Cairo, offering a modern, Rust-based implementation built on the portable wgpu API. Its focus is on pushing the boundaries of what's possible with GPU-accelerated 2D graphics by offloading core rendering tasks to compute shaders.
